comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Alfred Gwynne Vanderbilt I (October 20, 1877 – May 7, 1915) was a sportsman who died on the RMS Lusitania. Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alfred_Gwynne_Vanderbilt_I

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Vehicle has 1913 New York license plate.

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: Richard Arthur Norton and Wystan: Thanks for the additional information.  We'll add it to the record next time we update.

comment._content: old photo  ! I like 4*5   8*10  and 8*20 in .

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: See also rmslusitania.info/pages/saloon_class/vanderbilt_ag.html which includes "Vanderbilt was on his yacht with friend Thomas Slidell when they watched the Lusitania complete her maiden voyage to New York in September of 1907. Alfred was a frequent traveler and some years made as many as seven crossings." So he was probably at the Cunard Pier quite often.

comment.author: 43338352@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called License Plates in Old Photos, and we'd love to have this added to the group!
